name: Amari Phuket

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the deluxe room which faced the beach. It was a pleasure to sleep at night with the sounds of the waves. The balconies are very private so you could be in your own world. The rooms are very spacious although the bathrooms are very small for a luxury hotel. We also had consistent trouble with the toilet flush. But as soon as we called housekeeping for any problems they were there within a few minutes. We also found it strange that the TVs were not flat screens but rather the old ones and were far away from the bed for viewing – not that we came to watch TV.
reviews.title: perfect location just far enough from Patong
excellent ambience and great breakfast
reviews.text: We were very happy with the location in that it was close enough to Patong to walk, while not being in the middle of all the noise. The resort is very inclusive and you do not have to leave it to holiday. The staff are wonderful and tried to accommodate all our needs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa is very pricey but even if you do not have a massage there, you must go take a look at the location and the spa rooms. The effect is unbelievable but the massage not so great.
reviews.title: Service at Amari is better than anywhere else in Phuket

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a driver for 4 hours to see the main sights in Phuket – the Big Buddha, temples, an elephant ride and the scenic spots. Don't use the tour guide desk at the hotel – it was literally double the price of any booths down the street. We used a gut called Wit at the "Nice" booth. We also took the boat ride to Phi Phi and stayed there overnight. If you want to do this make sure that you book the right boat as not many give that option. On the way they stopped at two other islands for snorkeling, well worth it.
reviews.title: Far enough from Bangla Road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel put up a stage next to the pool area for Christmas shows. The construction was particularly noisy over one whole day and also blocked the entrance from the grassy areas to parts of the pool. After complaining, the manager of the hotel offered us a free meal at the very exclusive La Gritta restaurant on site.
reviews.title: oh to be lolled to sleep by the sea" heaven"

reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for our honeymoon. We spent newyear here and attended the newyear party. We have never seen soo much food . Every variety u can think of. The hotel staff are fantastic. They are so friendly and attentive. We cannot speak highly enough about them. The hotel is at the opposite end of the rd away from all the pubs and clubs, but only a 20 min walk or 200 bhat in a tuk tuk (£4). The food and drink in the hotel is expensive, so we had dinner in town every nite. A main course is around £20 which is a shame as all of the restaurants were so quite due to this. Drink was expensive too £10 for a glass of red wine!!!!! On the up side we were b&b and the breakfast spread was amazing.the rooms were basic, but comfortable, although the hotel was lovely! Pool facilities were adequate or u could have a bed on the pier which is beautiful. We will defo be back !
reviews.title: Fabulous fabulous fabulous !

reviews.text: its our third time staying here.
reviews.title: Excellent as always

reviews.text: we always fly to phuket at stay at the amari on our way to island hoping.
reviews.title: Peaceful and beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we cant fault the hotel in any way.
reviews.title: LOVELY HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the chaotic nature of Patong Beach during the Christmas season, this hotel offered a peaceful sanctuary after a hot day on the streets of Patong. The hotel is walking distance from the hustle and bustle of Patong town and Patong beach but far enough to offer peace and tranquility after a day out.
reviews.title: Excellent place, but still room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Amari Coral Beach Resort was in a fantastic location, a short walk to the restaurants and night life and on the beach. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a Superior room, which was 'tired' and the shower room small. The location more than made up for this. We asked for a non smoking room, but still got cigarette smoke from other peoples balconies/rooms. The breakfast was excellent, but again cigarette smoke wafted into the restaurant, from the smoking area which was at the front of the restaurant and garden area. The restaurants are very expensive, even with a 20% discount,and entertainment, each night the restaurants were mostly empty. Maybe if they reduced their prices more people would dine in the restaurants. We would return back to this hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Amari for a week purely for relaxation after an intensive sight-seeing tour!
reviews.title: An Oasis in an unlikely location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I only booked Phuket because it fitted in with my itinerary - I was aware that it is very commercial and more touristy than I would have liked. Now, a few years ago I used to love Ibiza and places like that, so I did not think I would ever be shocked by a resort... but shocked I was! Patong is HORRIBLE! Drove through it on the way from the airport and resolved not to go into town at all. And so I didn't. You are able to hear the atmosphere from the beach at the Amari at night, and also plenty of flashing lights and fireworks to remind you that this seething mass desperately seeking alcohol and "fun" is only just over the bay. There are some beautiful beaches and bays in Phuket so it is well worth the effort to go to other towns in the evening if you aren't up for the hard core stuff.
reviews.title: Fantastic - book it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But don't let that put you off the Amari. I genuinely liked this hotel and it is only thanks to the hotel that I enjoyed my week. The sun never really came out and it rained heavily every night, so the hotel had to be something special to make up for that! And it is!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though it is not suitable for people who can't/don't climb stairs the whole resort is pretty well laid out, given the constraints of being built on a steep hill! My room was about a 10 minute walk from reception, but I actually felt that was a benefit. I was very close to the lovely spa (really.. try it, I loved it!) and also to the Jetty walk. The pools are beautiful but quite heavily subscribed during the day (usual story of towels being laid out by 7 am even though the thoughtful owners (they rarely turn out to be British is all I am saying) don't appear until much later. So I decamped to the Jetty every day. It is about a 5 - 10 minute walk along the prettiest little path hugging the cliff and rolling up and down through a real jungle landscape (including waterfalls). There are just a handful of sunbeds on the Jetty, there is a bar and washroom facilities and you can also swim directly off the pier. It is truly delightful and you feel that you are in a truly luxurious boutique style resort. Staff here are so sweet and will bring you fragrant cold towels from time to time.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Amari Coral Beach Resort for six nights and loved every second! The resort is located at the southern end of Patong and has it's own quiet beachfront. It is a very well maintained resort and the service was great. We were upgraded to a Deluxe room. It was a wee way from reception, but very quiet. The room had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Excellent resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a package deal, which included breakfast, a Thai dinner and transfers, and I thought it was reasonably priced for what we got. We dined at three of the restaurants and had room service once and the food, although more expensive than non-resort food, was excellent.
reviews.title: This hotel stole my heart!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend Amari for those who want to be close to the action, but not right in it!
reviews.title: Close to everything, plenty of variety around the hotel, could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went on a romantic getaway and after reading great reviews on TA Amari Coral was our choice, and what a marvellous choice we made. From the moment we arrived at this amazing hotel, we were treated like royalty... The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and would bend over backwards to help you. Everything about this hotel was perfect! The location was brilliant, you are close enough to walk down the hill and into the hustle and bustle of Patong yet far enough to get away and relax. Everything about this hotel was wonderful, including the restaurant (especially the seafood barbeque) and the yummy buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent location, friendly staff, great hotel

reviews.text: This was the first hotel we went to in Phuket and the biggest mistake we made was transferring to a hotel in Karon, as all we could do was compare our second hotel to Amari Coral and the comparison was not even close, this is truly the best hotel I have ever been to and from now on when I travel to Phuket will be my first and only choice.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star resort as advertised.

aka: Amari Coral Beach Phuket Hotel Patong
description: Hidden away on a secluded beach near Patong, Amari Phuket (formerly known as Amari Coral Beach Phuket) is the ideal Phuket vacation spot no matter what you are seeking. With first-class restaurants, affordable luxury accommodation and a quiet private beach, this island resort hotel offers a holiday experience unlike any other. You can indulge in some well-deserved relaxation at the renowned Breeze Spa, offering a whole range of spa treatments and massages.Reward yourself, and come celebrate the magic of Phuket with Amari Phuket.
